alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 4:01PM CDT until June 21 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms near Segovia. 2 and 1/2 inches of rainfall has been estimated to have fallen from 2 miles west of Segovia to 7 miles southwest of Segovia. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Segovia, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 462 and 472. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Old Segovia Rd. crossing Johnson Fork, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, County Road 430 crossing Johnson Fork, County Road 430 crossing Joy Creek and KC 451 crossing Johnson Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
